Description: Rhomboid palette of mudstone (greywacke). Deep depression in centre on both faces. Thick bodied; oval in cross-section. One tip blunted, but not broken.
Curator's comments: Type like 91B in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery and Palettes (1921). Found in an undisturbed grave of a female together with animal remains, and a small basket containing malachite and a comb with ibex figure carved on top.
Bibliographic references: Brunton 1937 / Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture (p. 73)
